content.title: National Handicrafts Development Programme: Infrastructure And Technology Support: URBAN HAAT
content.details: The scheme 'Infrastructure and Technology Support: URBAN HAAT' is a Component/Sub-Scheme under the Umbrella Scheme 'National Handicrafts Development Programme'. The objective of this component is to set up a permanent marketing infrastructure in towns/ metropolitan cities to provide direct marketing facilities to handicrafts artisans/handloom weavers. This will enable them to sell their products around the year to a wider target audience (or customer segment). There will be an adequate number of stalls selling authentic Indian cuisine from various regions in the country by rotation.
benefits: Financial ceiling for urban haat is ₹ 8,00,00,000 for each unit.
40% of the admissible amount shall be borne by the O/o the DC(HC) and DC(HL) each.
20% of the admissible amount will be contributed by the implementing agency.
Assistance for strengthening/renovation of existing Urban Haats subject to a maximum financial limit of ₹ 2,50,00,000.
The Food & Craft Bazaar will provide leisure & recreational facilities for domestic as well as international tourists.
eligibility: Central/ State Handloom and Handicrafts Development Corporations
Central Cottage Industries Corporation of India Ltd. (CCIC)
Any other eligible Govt. Corporations/ agencies promoted by State Government or local Govt. bodies
National level Apex Societies (registered under the society act/ trust act, etc.)
Organizations like IICT, HMCM, NIFT, MHSC, and Export Promotion Councils.
content.application_process: Offline. Proposals in the prescribed proforma along with all the (self-attested) supporting documents in hard copy should reach the concerned Handicraft Service Center (HSC), O/o the DC (HC) in time.
documents_required: Recommendation letter of Field office/Regional Office.
Three years Balance Sheet & audited statement of accounts.
Affidavit in respect of Non-Corrupt Practice and validity of Registration.
Land ownership document/ Lease agreement for the proposed project/Detailed Project Report.
Feasibility report of the project to be certified by a scheduled commercial bank.
Construction plan and cost estimate duly authenticated by Architect/ Chartered Engineer.
Third-party assessment report from a recognized Chartered Engineer/ technical valuer for equipment/ machines to be installed.
Undertaking that balance of the total cost to be borne by the implementing agency, along with escalated cost, if any.
Any other documents mentioned in Proforma/ desired by the competent authority.

faqs.question: What Is The Full Form Of NHDP?
faqs.answer: The Full Form of NHDP is 'National Handicrafts Development Programme'.

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of The 'Urban Haat' Component Of The Infrastructure & Technology Support Scheme Of NHDP?
faqs.answer: The scheme 'Infrastructure & Technology Support: URBAN HAAT' is introduced to set up a permanent marketing infrastructure in towns/ metropolitan cities to provide direct marketing facilities to handicrafts artisans/handloom weavers, enabling them to sell their products to a wider target audience.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Area Of The Haat?
faqs.answer: The haat shall be constructed in an area of not less than 8,000 sq. m. and will have a display gallery, food court, etc.

faqs.question: Will The Allotment Of The Stalls To The Artisans Be Fixed Or Will It Be On A Rotational Basis?
faqs.answer: The stalls are allotted to artisans on a rotational basis for a nominal rent.

faqs.question: What Is The Full Form Of 'SPV'?
faqs.answer: The Full Form of 'SPV' is 'Special Purpose Vehicle'.
